title: [Large-Scale] Explicit Science Process Skills Instruction for Developing Scientific Reasoning Abilities in Preservice Science Teachers

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding of secondary science curriculum content and basic science teaching methodologies
context.additional_context: Smartphone-based learning as the primary environment, emphasizing scientific reasoning training using mathematical concepts

learning_goals: Preservice science teachers improve their ability to control variables and engage in hypothetico-deductive reasoning by over 30%.

Teachers create ≥3 mathematics lesson designs using sub-elements of scientific reasoning (variable control, hypothesis-deductive reasoning), achieving ≥80% suitability in peer review and expert evaluation.
Develop strategies to diagnose and improve vulnerable scientific thinking domains, such as conservation of matter, volume, proportionality, and probabilistic reasoning.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
